At TrainHeroic, we build solutions that help coaches and athletes Be their Best. Our web, mobile, and tablet tools enable smart and effective strength and conditioning. We proudly serve clients in the NFL, Olympics, High School/College, and private training facilities.

We’re a high performance culture that serves high performance coaches and athletes. We believe in servant leadership and are seeking humble, hungry, and smart change-makers striving to leave their mark on world.

Love is at the center of all we do. To be successful at TrainHeroic, you need to love what you do, love why you’re doing it, and love those you serve.

We’re looking for a Director of Marketing who is equal parts Leader, Producer, and Strategist to accelerate our growth to warp speed. Someone who cares to educate, drives to optimize, and craves a gnarly challenge.

As Director of Marketing at TrainHeroic, you’ll write the future for both an internal team and an industry. As the leader of a small group with big ambitions, you’ll own everything. Awareness, education, retention? It’s all you. Strategy, tactics, budget? Yup, that too. Process management, people development, culture creation? You’ve got it, partner.

You’re here to take our Marketing team from two to twelve. Our audience from tens of thousands to hundreds. As Director of Marketing, you’ll report directly to our CEO and be key part of the TrainHeroic leadership team.

For many, this level of autonomy and responsibility is terrifying. For the right person, it’s the perfect drug. This role requires an ideal team player with an entrepreneurial mindset. Build, measure, learn. Rinse and repeat.

Are you bold enough to take on this challenge? SELL US.

As Director of Marketing, you will: 
- Closely collaborate with the TrainHeroic leadership team to drive growth and engagement
- Manage the website, promotional and product campaigns, content development, PR, events, and other marketing and education efforts across all channels
- Own the strategy and tactical implementation of all marketing program budgets, projections, goals and objectives
- Activate and manage strategic partners including national governing bodies, professional athletes, coaches and industry brands
- Refine and manage the reputation, voice, and tone of the brand
- Regularly analyze and report quantitative and qualitative data to key stakeholders
- Hire, manage and mentor high performing marketing professionals and contractors

To be successful in this role, you possess:
- 5-10 years of direct marketing and strategic business experience
- 5+ years in managerial and leadership roles
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, English, Design, or equivalent experience in a related field
- Proven success developing strategies for all aspects of marketing (branding and PR, product promotion and advertising, partnerships, content, events, email, etc.)
- Strong understanding of market research and data analysis methods including experience with web analytics tools (Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc)
- Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills
- Beginner’s mindset, humbly and constantly seeking to learn
- Uncommon grit and resourcefulness

No BS, can-do, will-do attitude to get things done
...and Ideally:
- Experience in the strength and sports performance market as an athlete or coach
- Experience using TrainHeroic products and services
- Experience using Hubspot

Our Marketing Principles:
- Data-Driven: to align resources and priorities for maximum ROI
- Content Based: to educate and motivate while building trust
- LTV Focused: to attract the right eyeballs for long term engagement

***IMPORTANT APPLICATION NOTES***

1. We receive a high volume of applications.

2. All applications should clearly indicate to us that you're a real human. Robots need not apply. Seriously, have fun with it. Show us some personality. We wanna know who you are, what makes you tick, and how you'd fit in BEFORE we each sacrifice 30 minutes to hop on the phone for a call neither of us is going to be ecstatic about.

3. We hold creativity, grit, and hustle in the highest regard...interested applicants should take that into consideration and submissions should reflect these core beliefs

4. It's easy to TELL us you're creative, great, amazing, wonderful and chock-full of industry buzzwords...it's harder to SHOW us you are these things. We appreciate folks who take the hard route.

About TrainHeroic:

TrainHeroic operates under the umbrella company Peaksware, Inc. along with TrainingPeaks, MakeMusic, and Alfred Music. Together, we work to help people achieve their dreams through deliberate practice. We share an office in the trendy RiNo district of Denver, Colorado and have been recognized as one of Outside Magazine's "Best Places to Work" five times.

All Heroes Receive:
- Opportunity to work alongside passionate, A-players, striving to disrupt the status quo and lead in the industry
- Competitive compensation and incentives
- 100% company paid medical plan for employees with buy-up options as well as dental and vision insurance for employees (dependent coverage available)
- $1,200/yr fitness reimbursement for any healthy lifestyle and gym-related purchases
- Corporate discounts on gym memberships and top-brand gear
- 15-Days of PTO for all new hires…increases in PTO at various years of service
- 5% 401(k) Match Program
- Four week paid sabbatical for all employees after 7 years of service
- On-site workout area access: full weight lifting gym with Strength equipment, treadmill, bike trainers, and changing rooms, showers and towel service
- Stocked kitchen with snacks and drinks
- Dog friendly office
- Music Studio for all to practice, jam, and record
- Trendy Denver, CO location


Visit us at www.TrainHeroic.com to learn more!

Fan Manager has an opening for an account manager who will serve as the primary contact for our sports and entertainment customers. You will support them on their daily use of the Fan Manager platform while addressing their support needs.

The Fan Manager core product is a SaaS-based platform that enables sports and entertainment properties to monetize their fans.  Our client portfolio includes many properties in the NFL, MLB, NBA and NHL such as A.S. Roma, Atlanta Hawks, Boston Red Sox, Baltimore Ravens, and DC United.

The successful candidate will have outstanding project management skills and ensure that Fan Manager customer needs are anticipated and addressed.  With effective relationship-building and communication skills, you will be a trusted advisor and solution advocate for our customers. Note - this is not a sales position.

Responsibilities

- Serve as the clients’ trusted advisor and operate as the lead point of contact for all customer-specific issues
- Manage ongoing customer relationships and communications
- Drive customer engagement, platform usage, and retention
- Triage and prioritize customer support items while coordinating with internal team members
- Coordinate customer invoicing and contract change orders with legal and finance
- Understand company solutions, capabilities and services, and effectively communicate all offerings to clients

Required Skills

Our ideal account manager is highly self-motivated, proactive and enjoys working with business customers in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

This role requires the following experience: 
- Up to 5 years of account management experience, working with business (B2B) customers preferably in software-related industries
- BA/BS, or MBA in a sports management or related field preferred
- Superior project management, communication and organization skills
- Passion for sports and entertainment
- Understanding and working knowledge of data analytics and marketing technology a plus
- Experience interviewing, presenting, and interacting with senior business stakeholders across various disciplines
- Skilled with Google Docs and Microsoft Office Suite
- Must be willing to travel when needed

What We Offer
In addition to the great benefits below, we are conveniently located just a few blocks from South Station and the Harbor in beautiful downtown Boston.

- Insurance and benefit options that are built for both individuals and families, including generous company contributions
- Solid programs in some of the staples: flexible spending accounts, transportation, disability and life insurance
- Top-notch 401k savings plan
- High-quality and well-maintained equipment – we want you to have the tools you need to do your job
- On-site gym and access to a 1:1 trainer
- Plenty of vacation time to recharge your batteries and take a break
- Stocked kitchen with access to healthy snacks and plenty of free drinks and coffee 


Send your resume to careers@fanmanager.com

Company Description

GuardLab is a sports technology company changing the way you protect your teeth. We use 3D technology to create premium products that are accurate and comfortable, while being the most scientifically advanced – all at a fraction of what you would pay at the dentist, and available from the comfort of your home.  GuardLab is an official licensed partner of UFC, and has other partners and clients across all major professional and collegiate sports leagues including the NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, MLL and NCAA - including the multi-time Super Bowl Champion New England Patriots, the NCAA National Champion UNC Men’s Basketball, as well as the Tennessee Titans, Toronto Blue Jays, Philadelphia Eagles, Denver Nuggets and more. For additional information, visit GuardLab.com and follow @GuardLab on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 

Job Description

Are you looking for a career in the sports industry? Are you determined, passionate and goal-oriented? Are you an athlete or former athlete? Are you a driven sales professional? If so, this could be the job for you!

Job Description: SPORTS SALES REP

Location: Farmingdale NY, Headquarters/Greater NY Area

We make the best custom mouthguards on the planet and we’re on a mission to let athletes, everywhere, learn about GuardLab. We are looking for energetic Sales Reps to join our team and help grow our list of esteemed clients.

Our Sales Reps will be out, speaking to gyms, schools, sports leagues and teams to build a sales pipeline, close deals and educate the market about GuardLab mouthguards.

The ideal candidate has great rapport with people, likes sports, enjoys calling, emailing and traveling to meetings, is hyper-organized, works well with others and is driven to succeed. You also have strong negotiation and customer service skills.

Key Functions
- Responsible for building and managing a robust pipeline in designated markets and territories
- Follows up & closes on leads; constantly looking for new leads and referrals
- Demonstrates product knowledge and is able convey information succinctly
- Closes new business deals and maintains close relationships with current accounts
- Liaises with operations, marketing, dental and lab team members to ensure project outcomes are met
- Accurately takes purchase orders and customization details; seeks clarity when needed
- Updates CRM and databases on a daily/weekly basis
- Follows up on invoices and maintains sales records
- Handles customer service as needed

Qualifications

In addition to having a great attitude, high energy and a background in sports to achieve the tasks established above, the Sports Sales Representative must meet the following requirements:

- Min of 1-2 years of sales or account management experience
- Must have strong discipline to work in sales CRM software and achieve aggressive sales targets
- Self-motivated, ability to multi-task, and operate under pressure
- Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
- Valid Passport and Drivers’ License would be an asset
- Previous experience in sports, sports technology, retail sales, e-commerce or health and wellness is a plus
- Established relationships in sports industry a huge plus


Additional Information

Compensation :
- We are offering competitive commission, bonuses, incentives
- Unique opportunity be a part of growing sports brand!
- Great opportunity for growth
- Full training provided

How to Apply:
Please apply through the attached link and pls include a brief letter or statement telling us why you’re interested in joining GuardLab!

Diamond Kinetics’ (diamondkinetics.com) enhances the games of baseball and softball by creating engaging experiences that help players improve and also have fun. We are the market leader in mobile motion technology and information that enables player development, superior equipment fitting, objective scouting and recruiting, and engagement-driven entertainment. We do this leveraging an exclusive license to issued patents from the University of Michigan and the University of Pittsburgh, deep technical expertise, key strategic partnerships and our love for the game. 

Diamond Kinetics is a fast-paced, performance-driven company where responsibility comes fast and exceeding expectations is the expectation. The work is challenging but exciting, especially for those who love sports. We believe in stretching for growth as a company, and as professionals, and seek competitive, self-motivated people as teammates who do the same.

Job Description

You have classically trained consumer marketing skills and have been successful delivering results on large brands/businesses, but yearn to run your own business. Corporate life feels slow, limiting, and at times outright frustrating. You have sought out entrepreneurial or "skunk works" projects, perhaps even eschewing big company life for the thrill of an early-stage venture. You enjoy the challenge of generating step-change growth, with limited resources, in very dynamic markets. 

You understand and value data, but are just as comfortable applying logic and intuition in making business decisions. You are competitive and hate losing. When someone tells you that "you can't" you smile and take that as a challenge to prove them wrong. You prefer to roll up your sleeves and work with your team more than direct their efforts from your office. You mentor others and take great joy in seeing those around you grow professionally. You seek out the hard, the risky; see the 'diamond in the rough' and take the path less traveled to reveal it.


Job Function and Purpose:
The Director of Marketing leads the marketing, customer experience and e- commerce team within Diamond Kinetics. The role is responsible for generating consumer demand, translating into revenue to achieve company targets, and ensuring customer and consumer delight throughout their entire experience.


Success in this role is defined by: leading and maintaining a high performance team, developing marketing and customer support strategies aligned with company strategy, building executional plans that deliver results, and accomplishing big things with small budgets.

Know the Market:
- Understand the amateur baseball and fast pitch softball markets maintaining and expanding deep insights on players, parents, coaches, and key influencers
- Be the organizational expert on direct and indirect competitors, their strategies, products/technologies, strengths/weaknesses and leverage this knowledge to create strategic advantages
- Anticipate, insulate against and pre-empt competitive threats
- Develop Marketing Strategies and Plans:
- Translate organizational and product strategies into marketing strategies and executional plans that drive achievement of strategic and financial targets
- Using market insights and data and analytics, develop customer segments and tailor plans to maximize conversion and long-term organizational value
- Ensure plans are aligned and contribute to brand equity maintaining a consistent and appropriate “voice”
- Coordinate and align plans across all stakeholders internally and partners externally to ensure a holistic and synergistic brand impact across all channels and partners
- Apply fiscal rigor and discipline in establishing budgets, objectives, and reliable measures of impact and ROI

Drive Execution and Results:
- Establish challenging goals, set clear expectations, and hold self and team accountable for their delivery
- Lead team and personal execution of plans to deliver the expected results
- Delegate responsibility appropriately balancing business needs and individual capacity and capability
- Drive focus and prioritization in the midst of a dynamic market and rapid change; persist in the face of obstacles

Create Customer Loyalty:
- Demonstrate and champion a “customer first” mentality through team and across the organization
- Develop and optimize processes to support the customer and product experience; ensure “delight” throughout all stages
- Develop and maintain consistent customer feedback mechanisms and integrate into product development process
- Translate and facilitate customer “delight” into positive word-of-mouth, advocacy and product reviews

Lead and Develop the Team:
- Build, lead, and maintain a high performing team; build “bench strength” within the teamSet and model high standards of performance; hold self and team accountable
- Take an active role in the professional development of each member of the team

Qualifications

Competencies Required:
- Think strategically
- Engage and inspire people
- Establish sound plans and manage their execution
- Drive for results and own them
- Manage and improve processes
- Think and act with urgency
- Excellent listening, verbal and written communication skills
- Strong financial acumen and business judgment

Experience Required:
- B.A., B.S. or equivalent degree in Marketing or equivalent field of study
- 6-10 years of consistent success consumer marketing and subscriber-
based consumer software or mobile entertainment at increasing levels of responsibility
- Experience building and leading a high performance marketing team and managing third-party providers
- Expertise in all aspects of consumer engagement and subscription conversion through digital, email, social and event marketing and measuring impact and ROI
- Expertise in driving e-commerce through own website and online retailers
- Proficient in managing publicity and earned media
- Proficient using MS Office, CRM systems, SQL and all social platforms

Additional Desired Experience:
- MBA strongly preferred
- Played competitive-level amateur baseball or fast pitch softball
- Experience managing a customer service/support function and team 
- Ownership and management of brand and/or category P&L’s Start-up and/or early-stage company experience
Additional Information
- Applicants must currently reside in the Pittsburgh area or be willing to relocate with minimal organizational assistance
- Unique, exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, early stage sports technology company
- Flexible work environment
- Competitive compensation package including salary, bonus, stock options and
401K plan
- Occasional overnight travel required including some weekends and holidays
- Diamond Kinetics is an equal opportunity employer

Are you an entrepreneur? Like the idea of building a business from the ground up but with the backing of a 30-year-old company, known as the industry gold standard, who’s average employee tenure is 12 years? 
In this role you will help mold the future of applied biomechanics research and sports science. Our devices aren’t gadgets – they’re next generation wearable sensors, software and services backed by science and the world’s leading motion capture company. 

If you have the right blend of drive, empathy, customer advocacy, curiosity and creativity, you may just be the right Business Development Manager for IMeasureU. You will be working with US Pro Sports, Collegiate Kinesiology and Athletic departments and specifically, the high-performance teams that power them i.e. biomechanics researchers, sports scientists, PTs, S&Cs and athletes.

If you're passionate about science, technology and its ability to help athletes and teams win and stay healthy this may be the right opportunity for you. Naturally, you will be a high performer yourself and have a proven track record of sales and product development.

To succeed in this role, you need to be a more than just a sales person and more than just a product person. You will be presenting daily (face to face & web) to customers with a focus on learning, selling and iterating. You will be helping our product team continue to develop incredible experiences that will wow customers. Your primary responsibility will be sales but they won’t happen without the creation and ownership of (internal and external) business relationships, intimate understanding of customer problems & the ability to communicate solutions internally and externally as we rapidly iterate product-market fit.

This role is a unique opportunity to be an entrepreneur inside a company that is known globally as the gold standard in motion capture. You will be the “face of IMeasureU in the USA” and drive discussions with senior sports science leaders. You will be able to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges and map the intersection of customer needs and IMeasureU priorities. The ideal candidate will possess excellent customer engagement and communication skills as well as the technical understanding to drive deals across all stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities
- Oversee the entire sales cycle for your customers from prospect to close to contract completion
- Sell in a new load monitoring system to optimise return to play for athletes with lower limb injuries
- Build win-win relationships with colleges & teams
- Grow your sales pipeline independently and with Vicon field sales
- Assist with the identification and prioritization of key accounts which deliver the highest value to Vicon and IMU customers
- Preparing and lead annual business reviews with key customers that drive annual renewals
- Month on month sales growth 
- Help optimise product development through market insights
- Understand customer requirements and industry trends and feed that back constantly to our development team 
- Be the US ‘go to’ person for all things IMeasureU for biomechanics and sport
Qualifications and Education Requirements
- Clear understanding of and network in US Collegiate Athletics and Pro Sports Science
- History of year on year sales quota overachievement 
- Proven ability to bring a new product to market
- Postgraduate degree in science or business
Preferred Skills
- Experience working with high-performance athletes and teams in collegiate and or pro sports 
- Channel / Partner sales experience
- Software as a Service sales experience
- Athlete Management System / Excel skills
- Product Management experience

Benefits 
IMeasureU offers an excellent benefits package generous vacation allowance, and coworkers who are driven to succeed and enjoy a fun, challenging work environment.

Company Structure 
IMU is a subsidiary of Vicon Motion Systems and part of Oxford Metrics Plc, a public company founded in 1984 with a proven track record of growth, financial stability, technical innovation and long-term customer relationships.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

Six years ago, SportTechie launched as a blog with the belief that there was an incredible amount of activity and innovation at the intersection of technology and sports and there needed to be a news and information resource that was solely dedicated to covering this evolution. Little did we know, the collision of tech and sports would create a massive new industry and we would become a trusted resource that would help hundreds of thousands of sports industry leaders navigate this burgeoning space.

Today, dozens of new sports technology startups are launched every month, leading Silicon Valley tech companies are partnering with sports rights holders, athletes are becoming VC’s and technology is fundamentally changing how athletes train, stadiums are conceived and fans are entertained.

As a result of this sports technology boom, there is a growing demand for sophisticated and intelligent sports technology coverage. Thus, we are looking to enhance our talented editorial team with an Editor-In-Chief who will help us take SportTechie’s content operations to the next level and play a crucial role in providing long lasting value to our readers as the sports technology industry continues to evolve.

You will be empowered to:
- Manage the execution and vision of SportTechie’s business strategy as it relates to our content production
- Be an integral part of shaping our future as a company and industry resource
- Work closely with our team to add to existing content and produce new content such as expert interviews, industry reports, expert guests contributions, research libraries, webinars and more
- Develop and execute a multimedia publishing strategy focused on growing our core audience and providing value to SportTechie PRO members
- Write, interview, edit, create, manage, envision SportTechie content
- Make a name for yourself as a sports technology expert and thought leader

What we are looking for:
- An entrepreneurial spirit who believes in what SportTechie is building and wants to help lead our success
- Must have experience managing editorial teams and executing content strategies in coordination with overall business and audience development goals
- Experience in producing content for a membership or paywall offering
- Success with developing and executing new strategies to grow audience reach
- 10 or more years of editing and managing experience at a technology or sports publication
- Working knowledge of the key players, trends and businesses in the sports industry
- Strong understanding of digital media, SEO, social media and online content strategy
- Prior experience with CMS platforms, particularly Wordpress
- Exceptional communicator
- Ability to execute regular job duties whether you are in a coffee shop, airport terminal or your home office

Job Location
- Work from home with consistent daily communication with the SportTechie team
- Los Angeles or New York - (offices coming soon)
Compensation
- Competitive salary, benefits and equity package

How to apply - info@SportTechie.com

Email us your cover letter, resume and top three examples from your writing portfolio that can help show why you will excel at leading our content execution. 

Additionally, please include any relevant background about yourself and your previous editorial experiences that will further illustrate your fit for this position.

Note: Please try to demonstrate personality, sports tech knowledge and logical reasons for why you will be a good candidate to fill this vital role on the SportTechie team.
